data.fullContent: The formation of climate in Azerbaijan is influenced particularly by cold arctic air masses of Scandinavian anticyclone, temperate of Siberian anticyclone, and Central Asian anticyclone. Azerbaijan's diverse landscape affects the ways air masses enter the country. The Greater Caucasus protects the country from direct influences of cold air masses coming from the north. That leads to the formation of subtropical climate on most foothills and plains of the country. Meanwhile, plains and foothills are characterized by high solar radiation rates.
data.answer: 阿塞拜疆气候的形成受北欧反气旋、西伯利亚反气旋和中亚反气旋的北极冷气团的影响尤为明显。阿塞拜疆多样的地形影响了气团进入这个国家的方式。大高加索地区保护了这个国家免受来自北方的冷空气团的直接影响。这导致了亚热带气候的形成，在大多数丘陵地带和平原的国家。同时，平原和丘陵地带的太阳辐射率也很高。
